def priority(item: float, bins: np.ndarray) -> np.ndarray:
    """Returns priority with which we want to add item to each bin.

    Args:
        item: Size of item to be added to the bin.
        bins: Array of capacities for each bin.

    Return:
        Array of same size as bins with priority score of each bin.
    """
    """Even more optimized version of priority calculation."""
    
    priorities = np.zeros_like(bins)  # Initialize priority array
    
    # Edge case: if item exceeds all bin capacities, assign highest priority to the bin with largest capacity
    if item > np.max(bins):
        priorities[np.argmax(bins)] = 1.0
        return priorities
    
    remaining_bins = bins.copy()  # Create copy of bins to track remaining capacities
    
    # Loop through bins to calculate priority based on available capacity
    for i in range(len(bins)):
        if remaining_bins[i] >= item:
            priorities[i] = item / remaining_bins[i]
            break
        else:
            priorities[i] = remaining_bins[i] / item
            item -= remaining_bins[i]
            remaining_bins[i] = 0
    
    return priorities
